concept.title: Specifying Host Identifiers in Centera NSAs

conbody.p: The simplest host identifier is an IP address or host name.
Syntax for specifying the host identifier of a Centera unit:<IP_Address>[:<port>]|<Host_Name>[:<port>]

p.note: In the syntax above, the pipe symbol (|) is the meta-syntax character that separates mutually exclusive options.

conbody.p: You can specify multiple Centera host identifiers in a single NSA. Specifying multiple host identifiers allows use, even when one or more Centera systems are unavailable.
